title: Tagalog Loanwords in English
description: From boondocks to yo-yo, discover the Filipino Tagalog words that have found a home in English!

questions.question: The word 'boondocks' comes from the Tagalog 'bundok.' What does 'bundok' mean?
Which popular toy's name likely comes from the Tagalog word 'yoyo'?
The word 'cogon' (a type of tropical grass) comes from Tagalog. What is cogon grass known for?
options: Being one of the world's most invasive weeds

questions.question: Which English slang word meaning 'to eat' or 'food' may have roots in the Tagalog 'kain' (to eat)?
The Tagalog word 'barangay' entered English to describe what?
options: The smallest administrative division in the Philippines

questions.question: Which word for a type of water buffalo comes from the Tagalog 'kalabaw'?

Which Tagalog-derived English word refers to an older woman who acts as a chaperone?
The word 'boondocks' was popularized in American English during which war?
options: World War II and the Philippine-American War
